channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 3 inch wide sinkhole emerged in pavement - at least 12 inches deep and edges are breaking away fast, increasing size of hole, 21st July
item.description:
The sinkhole is in the pavement right at the entrance to 72 Malleson Road ('Barefoot House'), toward the western side of the opening for the driveway. It appeared suddenly in the last week or so (not sure of exact date and, as noted above, the edges (since the ground underneath is completely absent) are breaking away - soon it may be large enough that a pedestrian could sink their foot into it, which would likely break their ankle (using a stick it seems to be about a foot deep)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White lines barely visible on pavement around Westal Green, 21st July
item.description:
The white lines indicating the separation of cycles and pedestrians on the pavement between St Stephen’s Road and Hatherley Road is a potential safety issue, especially near the Westal Green crossing. This report is similar the the one I have just submitted but is at the other side of the dual carriageway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Lack of markings on pavement to indicate cycling and pedestrian areas, 21st July
item.description:
This is not a road but a pavement marking issue. It is unclear where cyclists and pedestrians have right of way near the crossing at Westal Green. Please could the white lines be repainted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Noisy manhole cover, very disturbing, bangs loudly all day and night. It's a very busy road, every car/van/lorry/bus goes over it throughout the day and night. Please fix it before a vehicle disappears down it. The noise has been happening since February, 21st July
item.description:
In the middle of the carriageway between the entrance to the Esso garage and the entrance/exit of HSC cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Hucclecote Road, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple issues on same stretch of road, 21st July
item.description:
Queens Road, Cheltenham, GL50 2NE. From crown of old railway bridge to mid-way between junctions with Glencairn Park Road and Queens Court (approx 150m): - large area of wearing course missing, between crown of railway bridge and junction with Kensington Avenue; - small area of wearing course missing, adjacent to junction with Kensington Avenue; - further small patches of wearing course missing, adjacent to junction with Glencairn Park Road; - multiple potholes along utility trench, adjacent to junction with Kensington Avenue; - multiple potholes along stretch from junction with Kensington Avenue to mid-way between junctions with Glencairn Park Road and Queens Court. This whole stretch (approx. 150m) needs fully stripping and full resurfacing, NOT random patch repairs. It is at least as bad as stretch of Queens Road from Christ Church Road crossroads to A40 Lansdown Road was, which was fully resurfaced a few months ago. Mouth of Kensington Avenue also needs to be resurfaced at same time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hugely overgrown Lime tree, limbs exposed and drop regularly in wind. Danger to pedestrians and vehicles. Needs to be cut back significantly to reduce danger to pedestrians/property/vehicles, 21st July
item.description:
Lime tree outside 18 Selkirk Street, Cheltenham Needs significantly cutting back immediately for safety reasons. Exposed dying dropping branches.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Selkirk Street, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees on both sides of road obscuring traffic lights when travellin East, 21st July
item.description:
Approaching the traffic lights going East trees on both sides of the road obscuring traffic lights. Light only visible at 100 metres. VERY SERIOUS.

item.title: Inaccessible footpath., 21st July
item.description:
Footpath from Greenway Lane to Ham Brook inaccessible due to gateway on roadside being completely overgrown. Not sure what happens if you could get through the gate. It looks as though the footpath may have been blocked by a fence further on. This is on land up for sale.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenway Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Items left by maintenance, 20th July
item.description:
Hi. Manhole cover was mended months ago. But all this stuff has been left blocking the pavement and needs to be removed please. Obstructing pedestrians and a danger as have to step into the rush. The job was completed ages ago, we don’t understand why this is all still here ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, St Luke's Place, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Mirror on junction with mill lane, 20th July
item.description:
The mirror on the junction with mill lane in stoke orchard is crazed and so is not clear. Needs fixing to prevent an accident happening on the blind junction I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///full.proud.heap https://w3w.co/full.proud.heap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
